Note: A person can have more than one nationality, depending on the context. In this case, Boris Kliot was born in Latvia, so he is a Latvian national. After immigrating to the US, he also became an American national.

location contains.content:
Please analyze the following paragraph to determine the hierarchical relationship between two geographical locations mentioned. Specifically, identify which location is broader and encompasses the other, more specific location.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Broader Location', 'Specific Location', 'Whether the Broader Location contains the Specific Location']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

Paragraph:  KLIOT Boris , 84 , born in Riga , Latvia , survived four concentration camps before he immigrated to the US where he became a successful entrepreneur . 

Let's think step by step.

The two geographical locations mentioned in the paragraph are "Latvia" and "Riga".

"Latvia" is the broader location as it is a country, and "Riga" is a specific location within that country, as it is the capital city of Latvia.

Here is the hierarchical relationship presented as a Markdown table:

| Broader Location | Specific Location | Whether the Broader Location contains the Specific Location |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Latvia | Riga | Yes |

place of birth.content:
Please analyze the birthplace connections in the following text. Identify the location where the individual was born.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Person', 'Birth Place', 'Whether the Person was born in the Birth Place']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

Paragraph:  KLIOT Boris , 84 , born in Riga , Latvia , survived four concentration camps before he immigrated to the US where he became a successful entrepreneur . 

Let's think step by step.

Here is the analysis of the birthplace connections in the text:

Boris Kliot was born in Riga, Latvia.

Here is the Markdown table:

| Person          | Birth Place   | Whether the Person was born in the Birth Place |
|----------------|--------------|-----------------------------------------------|
| KLIOT Boris     | Riga, Latvia | Yes                                            |

The 'Person' column contains the name of the person mentioned in the text. The 'Birth Place' column contains the place where the person was born, and the 'Whether the Person was born in the Birth Place' column contains either 'Yes' or 'No' to indicate whether the person was born in the specified birthplace. In this case, Boris Kliot was born in Riga, Latvia, so the value in the third column is 'Yes'.
